article.headline: Ohio 75, Eastern Michigan 63
article.story: YPSILANTI, Mich. (AP) -- Sonny Troutman scored 19 points and Leon Williams added 14 to lead Ohio University to a 75-63 victory over Eastern Michigan. Mychal Green added 11 Wednesday night for the Bobcats (9-2, 3-0 Mid-American), who have won three consecutive games and are off to their best conference start since the 2000-01 season. Freshman Gino Smith scored 18 points to lead the Eagles (3-8, 0-3), who have lost four straight and five of their last six games. John Bowler had 16 points and 11 rebounds. He entered the game as the conference's leading scorer, averaging 20.2 points. The score was close during the first two minutes before Ohio held Eastern Michigan scoreless over a 6:05 stretch and outscored the Eagles 17-1 to take a 22-6 lead. The Eagles used a 12-4 run over the final five minutes of the half to pull within 39-31, but the Bobcats came back with six points in the final 10 seconds to push their lead to 14 points. Ohio extended its cushion to as much as 20 points in the second half and did not let the Eagles come closer than 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
